sources.first_edition: 1798, Paris, Pleyel (Op. 40), no. 1 of Six quartettino pour deux violons, alto et basse composés par Luigi Boccherini, oeuvre 40, Prix 9 liv., gravés par Richomme, à Paris, Chez Ignace Pleyel, Rue Neuve des Petits Champs n° 1286 vis-à-vis la Trésorerie. Propriété de l'éditeur. Enregistré à la Bibliothèque Nationale. Plate no. 132.

entries.notes: No MSS. of any kind are known. Some copies, probably the earliest, have the address ... Petits Champs n° 728 entre les Rues de la Loi et Helvétius. Fétis (op. cit.), not having seen this Op. 40, assumed that it was a new edition of Artaria Op. 32 (Nos. 195 to 200). An examination of the contract signed by

sources.first_edition: 1798, Paris, Pleyel: Op. 40 no. 6 (for title and comment, see No. 240).

continues_from_previous.notes: No MSS. of any kind are known.

partial_notes: Entry 240 appears to continue from a previous page with movement 2, and continues onto the next page with incomplete notes section.
